entry.title: US SMS Carrier Maintenance - US Cellular
entry.summary: THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 20, 22:00 PDT - Apr 21, 03:00 PDT Apr 19, 17:58 PDT Scheduled - The US Cellular network in the USA is conducting a planned maintenance from 20 April 2023 at 22:00 PDT until 21 April 2023 at 03:00 PDT. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays delivering SMS to and from US Cellular handsets via US longcode, US shortcode and US toll-free numbers.

Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

entry.title: UPDATE: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Meet. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are unable to access Google Meet, but we've provided a workaround below.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-04-14 07:00 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

The fix has now been deployed to the Beta release channel and available to customers. Customers wishing to expedite the update can switch impacted rooms to the Beta release channel which typically takes 2-4 hours to propagate after which time the subsequent reboots of the device should not experience the issue.

We plan to release this fix to the Stable release channel the week of April 24th after we have ensured a successful roll out to Beta.

We request any customers that opt to switch their rooms to the Beta channel should switch them back to Stable channel after the update to ensure the devices remain on the stable release track.

More information on how to change between Beta and Stable channels is available here : https://support.google.com/a/answer/4618201?hl=en&ref_topic=3341450&visit_id=638176138740742021-1958539996&rd=1#settings&zippy=%2Cchange-settings-for-all-devices

We will provide more information by Friday, 2023-04-21 14:00 US/Pacific

Workaround :

Customers affected with this issue may try the following steps for mitigation if the reboot does not fix the issue.

  1. Unplug network cable on the Meet Hardware device.
  2. Reboot the device.
  3. Wait until it shows the network connectivity screen (this is the screen that prompts the user to select a wifi connection).
  4. Plug in network cable back into the Meet hardware device.
  5. Device should recover after this step is completed.

Affected products: Google Meet

entry.title: RESOLVED: We're aware of a problem with Classroom affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Apr 19, 2023, 4:00 PM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change. The affected users are unable to access Classroom, but we've provided a workaround below.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-04-19 02:04 and ended at 2023-04-20 15:00 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Mini Incident Report

We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption/outage may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Workspace Support using the help article https://support.google.com/a/answer/1047213.

(All Times US/Pacific)

Incident Start: 18 April 2023 19:04

Incident End: 20 April 2023 7:56

Duration: 1 day, 12 hours, 52 minutes

Affected Services and Features:

Classroom Android Mobile App

Regions/Zones: Global

Description:

Google Classroom application was unavailable for some Android users for a period of 1 day, 12 hours, 52 minutes. From preliminary analysis, the root cause is identified as an unintended release misconfiguration.

Customer Impact: An estimated ~2.5% of users could not use the Android Classroom app (latest version). ~2M users were believed to be impacted.

  • Version Name: 8.0.141.20.90.2
  • Version Code: 213051414

Additional details:

The following workaround steps were provided to users during the incident:

  • Delete/reinstall the app
  • Use Classroom Web

Affected products: Classroom

entry.title: UPDATE: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Meet. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are unable to access Google Meet, but we've provided a workaround below.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-04-14 07:00 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Mitigation work is currently underway by our engineering team. We have a fix that is currently being tested by our team, and plan to release it to the Beta channel by Thursday, 2023-04-20 18:00 US/Pacific. Customers wishing to expedite the update can switch impacted rooms to the Beta release channel. This update typically takes 2-4 hours to update after the switch to the Beta release channel, and would require a restart after this time period.

We plan to release this fix to the Stable release channel the week of April 24th after we have ensured a successful roll out to Beta.

We request any customers who opt to switch their rooms to the Beta channel to switch them back to Stable channel after the update, to ensure the devices remain back on the stable release process

More information on how to change between Beta and Stable channels is available here : https://support.google.com/a/answer/4618201?hl=en&ref_topic=3341450&visit_id=638176138740742021-1958539996&rd=1#settings&zippy=%2Cchange-settings-for-all-devices

Our engineering team has also identified a workaround for devices that are not able to get past the "Waiting for application window" screen after a reboot. Please refer to the workaround section for details.

We will provide more information by Thursday, 2023-04-20 18:00 US/Pacific

We apologize to all who are affected by the disruption

Workaround :

Customers affected with this issue may try the following steps for mitigation if the reboot does not fix the issue.

  1. Unplug network cable on the Meet Hardware device.
  2. Reboot the device.
  3. Wait until it shows the network connectivity screen (this is the screen that prompts the user to select a wifi connection).
  4. Plug in network cable back into the Meet hardware device.
  5. Device should recover after this step is completed.

Affected products: Google Meet

entry.title: Incident: A small percentage of users may be experiencing slowness in Slack.
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On April 20th, 2023 from 6:00 AM PDT until 7:45 AM PDT, a small number of users experienced latency issues when using Slack. Users reported a delay in loading threads, channels, direct messages, marking messages as read, and executing workflows.
The issue resulted from an increased database load on one of our data center regions. We made a change in order manage the larger load and return to normal response times.
Our team is continuing to look into what causes some queries to run slower than others to prevent degraded performance in the future.
Thank you for your patience while we worked through this. We apologize for any disruption to your work.

entry.title: RESOLVED: We're aware of a problem with Classroom affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Apr 19, 2023, 4:00 PM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change. The affected users are unable to access Classroom, but we've provided a workaround below.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-04-19 02:04 and ended at 2023-04-20 15:00 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

The issue has been mitigated and a new application update has rolled out to a majority of impacted users as of Thursday, 2023-04-20 08:00 US/Pacific.

Users should look for an update in the Play Store in the next few days. If users continue to experience the original issue, please use Classroom Web.

We thank you for your patience while we worked on resolving the issue.

Affected products: Classroom

entry.title: UPDATE: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Meet. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are unable to access Google Meet, but we've provided a workaround below.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-04-14 07:00 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Mitigation work is currently underway by our engineering team. We have a fix that is currently being tested by our team, and plan to release it to the Beta channel by the end of the day. Customers will be able to switch any critical rooms that need to receive the update to the Beta release channel.

We request any customers that do opt to switch their rooms to the Beta channel to switch them back to Stable after the update, thereby ensuring they remain back on the stable release process.

We plan to release this fix to the Stable release channel the week of April 24th after we have ensured a successful roll out to Beta.

Our engineering team has also identified a workaround for devices that are not able to get past the "Waiting for application window" screen after a reboot. Please refer to the workaround section for details.

We will provide more information by Thursday, 2023-04-20 18:00 US/Pacific.

Workaround

Customers affected with this issue may try the following steps for mitigation if the reboot does not fix the issue.

  1. Unplug network cable on the Meet Hardware device.
  2. Reboot the device.
  3. Wait until it shows the network connectivity screen (this is the screen that prompts the user to select a wifi connection).
  4. Plug in network cable back into the Meet hardware device.
  5. Device should recover after this step is completed.

Affected products: Google Meet

entry.title: UPDATE: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Meet. We will provide more information shortly. The affected users are unable to access Google Meet, but we've provided a workaround below.
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2023-04-14 07:00 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Mitigation work is currently underway by our engineering team. A fix has been developed and it is currently being validated.

We do not have an ETA for mitigation at this point.

Our engineering team has also identified a workaround for devices that are not able to get past the "Waiting for application window" screen after a reboot. Please refer to the workaround section for details.

We will provide more information by Thursday, 2023-04-20 09:00 US/Pacific.

We apologize to all who are affected by the disruption

Workaround

Customers affected with this issue may try the following steps for mitigation if the reboot does not fix the issue. Steps:

  1. Unplug network cable on the Meet Hardware device.
  2. Reboot the device.
  3. Wait until it shows the network connectivity screen (this is the screen that prompts the user to select a wifi connection).
  4. Plug in network cable back into the Meet hardware device.
  5. Device should recover after this step is completed.

Affected products: Google Meet

entry.title: v2021.12.31 Migration Enforcement
entry.summary: Apr 18, 00:00 PDT Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Apr 17, 00:00 PDT In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Apr 14, 10:19 PDT Scheduled - The deprecation date for API Version 2021.12.31 is on March 31, 2023. Starting on April 17th, 2023, any applications that have not fully migrated will be automatically migrated to a newer version, which can result in application breakage. Automatic migration will occur in phases as detailed in https://developer.airbnb.com/docs/versioning-enforcement Phase 1 begins April 17, 2023 for the following endpoints: Transactions, Resolutions, Users, Opportunities

entry.title: New damage deposit payment management setting
entry.summary:
New!
We are happy to announce that new damage deposit payment settings are now available in your Smily account. Those new settings will allow you to better manage your damage deposit payments, as well as provide a better experience to your guests. Why the changes? Up until now, when going to your general damage deposit payment management settings (in Settings > Payments > Default preferences), the only option available regarding the collection of your damage deposit was the collection time: either with bookings payment or on arrival. Both options led to the damage deposit being due via the Smily payment link, and to wrong information being displayed on the Smily payment page and the Smily booking contract in case you were managing your damage deposit via a partner app such as Swikly. Wh…

author.name: JB, FinOps Product Dept. Director & Core CS Team Lead

entry.title: Incident: Channels are missing for Android users
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On April 16rd, 2023 from 12:11 PM PDT until 14:39 PM PDT, certain Android users on the Free plan reported issues with loading channels in the Android app.
Upon investigation, this was attributed to the implementation of a data optimization feature, intended to improve app performance. We have rolled back this feature temporarily, which has corrected the observed issue. A full investigation and remedy will take place prior to reimplementation.
Thank you for your patience while we worked through this. We apologize for any disruption to your work.

entry.title: Incident: Direct messages view failing to load
entry.summary: This issue has now been resolved, please reload Slack to restore functionality to the direct messages view. Thank you for your patience while we worked on this.

entry.title: Incident: Images slow to upload
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On April 10, 2023 at 7:30 PM PDT, some customers began experiencing delays when uploading files. We traced the issue back to a recent update made to how some file uploads are handled. Reverting this change fixed the issue, and customers were no longer experiencing it as of April 11, 2023 at 7:33 AM PDT.
Thank you so much for your patience as our team actively worked on this.

entry.title: Issue impacting users in Korea
entry.summary: Apr 10, 17:10 PDT Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Apr 10, 12:29 PDT Monitoring - Impacted users should see improvements when interacting with static elements. We're still actively monitoring the issue. Apr 6, 23:01 PDT Investigating - We are experiencing performance issues that may impact users in Korea. Users may experience significant delays when interacting with static content, like images and videos. Engineering is investigating the root cause of the degradation.

entry.title: Twitter app is down
entry.summary: Apr 7, 17:19 CEST Resolved - While we still await details from Twitter the only way how to create a connection at this moment is to have every user to create their own Twitter app at developer.twitter.com and use the apps API Key and API Key Secret to create a new connection in Make. We updated our documentation with details about how to obtain API Key and API Key Secret - https://www.make.com/en/help/apps/marketing/twitter#obtaining-api-key-and-api-key-secret-values-for-your-twitter-account Apr 3, 23:56 CEST Update - Twitter has suspended our app. We are continuing to investigate. Apr 3, 21:29 CEST Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

entry.title: Reminder - Important information regarding your website domain!
entry.summary:
Action required
Following our recent messages concerning the changes needed for your website domains, we would like to inform you that we have extended the support for the previous configuration until April 10 2023. If you have not made the needeed changes yet, please consult our manual article here. If you need assistance doing the changes, please contact our support team and we will be happy to assist you with the modifications. Please make sure to have access to your registrar (Gandi, OVH, Godaddy…) so we can assist you in performing this change. Thanks,

author.name: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team

The incident was active between April 4th 20:00 PDT and April 5th 00:00 PDT. You can retry any failed requests at this point, and if you keep experiencing issues, please contact the API integration team for additional help. We apologize for the inconvenience caused. Apr 5, 00:51 PDT Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Apr 4, 23:15 PDT Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Apr 4, 21:57 PDT Investigating - We are currently investigating an issue related to 403 and 404 Errors across multiple endpoints. We'll post updates as we have more information.

entry.title: XML Migration Enforcement
entry.summary: Apr 5, 01:46 PDT Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Jul 5, 13:00 PDT In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Jun 30, 10:55 PDT Scheduled - As announced on July 5, 2021 we are deprecating our XML API connection. XML listings can no longer be activated: this means that new XML listings will remain unlisted even if you set true . The same is valid for existing listing that are deactivated (i.e. you will not be able to reactivate a XML listing if it gets unlisted). More information about this enforcement here: https://developer.airbnb.com/docs/enforcement

entry.title: TS-2023-004
entry.summary: Description: An issue in the Tailscale coordination server allowed tailnets created by GitHub organizations which were subsequently renamed to be associated with a new GitHub organization with the previous name. What happened? Tailscale mapped tailnets created by GitHub organizations to their organization name, rather than to their organization ID. This meant that if a GitHub organization was renamed, and the previous name taken over by a new GitHub organization, the existing tailnet would be tied to the new GitHub organization instead of the original one. Who is affected? Up to 1,305 tailnets created by GitHub organizations may have been affected, if those GitHub organizations were renamed between 2021-06-18 and 2023-03-30 and fully relinquished the old GitHub organization name. Additiona…

entry.title: Incident: Some users have trouble receiving 2FA code via SMS
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On April 3rd, 2023 from 11:00 AM PDT until 11:45 AM PDT, users on certain cellular service networks had issues receiving SMS texts for two-factor authentication (2FA).
Upon investigation, this was traced to one unverified toll free number, which prevented 2FA codes from being approved for delivery. That number was removed from our 2FA pool, and services have resumed as usual. We are reviewing our process and alerting around outgoing phone number verification to ensure the issue doesn't happen again.

entry.title: Incident: Some users are unable to sign-in using the Continue with Google feature on the Android and iOS app
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From March 31st, 2023 at 7:18 PM PDT to April 1st, 2023 at 11:30 AM PDT, some customers may not have been able to sign in to Slack with the 'Continue with Google' feature.
During a routine cleanup process, we made some changes to the project behind the 'Continue with Google' feature. This change inadvertently prevented the Slack mobile apps from confirming the validity of customer Google accounts during login.
We reverted this change, restoring normal login behaviour for all affected customers, and we're working to ensure it does not happen again. We apologize for any disruption to your work.

entry.title: Reservation webhooks with $0 price
entry.summary: Mar 27, 15:42 PDT Resolved - We have identified and resolved an internal issue that resulted in reservation webhook notifications being sent with $0 price. The incident was active between 13:40 and 14:20 PDT. Reservations payments were processed correctly, but nightly prices and fees appeared as $0 within the webhooks. Please use the GET Reservations API to retrieve the correct reservations prices. Alternatively, please contact the API Integrations team for additional help. Apologies for the inconvenience.

Thank you very much for your patience while we worked on getting this fix out the door.

entry.summary: Mar 24, 21:10 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Mar 24, 21:05 UTC Update - We are aware of TLS problems related to an expired certificate in our CDN configuration. We are working to resolve this issue. Mar 24, 20:49 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Pages.

entry.title: Incident: “Time when workflow started” variable is missing from Workflow Builder steps
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On March 21, 2023 at 7:32 AM PDT to March 22, 2023 at 8:06 AM PDT, the "Time when workflow started" variable is missing from all steps of the Workflow Builder for new and existing workflows. If the variable was used to publish to a Google Sheet, the cell would be empty.
We discovered a bug that made date fields invisible without any errors displayed, though workflows were still running and had access to the value.
We have released a fix on March 22, 2023 at 8:06 AM PDT. Previously impacted workflows need to retrieve the timestamps from the workflow in the Workflow Builder. We appreciate your patience while we sorted this out.
